title: Who will you be when the shaking stops?
teaser: Everything unstable has been shaken. What remains is what's real. You are still here. You are still His.
framework: Matthew 6:33 - Seek first the kingdom... and all these things will be added

panels.heading: AFTER THE SHAKING
panels.content:
You started this week asking: When everything that defined you is shaken, who are you?

Your country is still fracturing. Political violence hasn't stopped. 47.9 million are still food insecure. The systems are still failing.

The ground is still shaking.

But something has changed: **You're not looking to the ground anymore.**

You've learned your worth isn't tied to your nation's stability, your job title, your productivity, your performance.

You are named. Loved. Known. By God.

And when everything unstable is shaken away, **that's** what remains.

panels.heading: WHAT SURVIVES THE FIRE
panels.content:
There's an ancient image for this: refining fire.

Gold goes into the furnace mixed with dirt, ore, impurities. The fire burns hot. Everything unstable melts away.

What's left? **Pure gold.**

Your identity has been in the fire this week. The labels, the borrowed narratives, the performance-based worth—it's all been burned away.

And what remains?

**You. Known by God. That's what's real.**

Not your résumé. Not your politics. Not your bank account.

The you that God has always seen.

Stripped. Refined. Unshakeable.

panels.heading: WHAT YOU CARRY FORWARD
panels.content:
So who will you be when the shaking stops?

You'll still have bills. You'll still have work. You'll still live in 2026 America with all its chaos and fracturing.

But you'll carry something different: **an identity that doesn't collapse.**

When the news reports violence, you won't spiral—because your peace isn't tied to national stability.

When your job feels unstable, you won't panic—because your worth isn't tied to productivity.

When culture demands you pick a side and perform your allegiance, you'll remember: **you are God's first.**

That's the kingdom identity. It survives the shaking.

And it changes how you move through the world.

illustration.description: Dithered image of tree with deep roots standing after storm, or refined gold emerging from fire

panels.heading: JESUS SENDS YOU OUT
panels.content:
At the end of his time on earth, Jesus gathered his followers—the same people who'd been asking "who are we?" for three years.

He'd shown them: You're not defined by political power. Not by religious performance. Not by cultural status.

You're mine. You're sent.

And then he said:

**"Go and make disciples of all nations... And I am with you always, to the very end of the age."**

You are named. Loved. Known.

Now go live from that identity.

Not to prove yourself. But because you're already His.

That's the sending.

panels.heading: SEEK FIRST THE KINGDOM
panels.content:
You started this journey with shaking. You end it with grounding.

Jesus said: **"Seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you."**

The kingdom is where your identity is secure. Where you are named before you perform. Where you are loved before you achieve.

When you seek that first—when you root yourself in **whose** you are instead of **what** you do—everything else finds its place.

Not because circumstances stabilize. But because **you're standing on something that doesn't shake.**

That's the kingdom. That's your identity.

And it's unshakeable.

panels.heading: THE SENDING
panels.content:
God,

When everything that defined me was shaken, You remained.

You named me when labels failed. You loved me when performance collapsed. You knew me when I didn't know myself.

I'm not the same as I was five days ago.

The ground is still shaking. But I'm not looking to the ground anymore.

I'm looking to You.

Send me out with this identity: Yours. Loved. Known.

Let me live from that, not for that.

Amen.
